definition: to cast/to send/to throw oneself (into the river etc)/to seek refuge/to place oneself into the hands of
to send/to mail/to entrust/to depend on/to attach oneself to/to live (in a house)/to lodge/foster (son etc)

sentences.english: At that point, she told the woman she could not forward her résumé to the hiring company.
sentences.chinese: 就此，她告诉妇女不要将简历投寄到雇佣公司。

sentences.english: I need to send this as regular post.
This need to go first class.
sentences.chinese: 这邮件需要以优先投寄的方式发送。

sentences.english: Please fill in this Form and hand it to our acceptance staff at the time of posting or pick-up.
sentences.chinese: 请填妥本表格，并于投寄或上门收件时交予收件职员。

sentences.english: He said he would drop the parcel off at the post office.
sentences.chinese: 他说他要在邮局把那个包裹投寄掉。

sentences.english: There are twelve registered letters to be sent in addition to this packet.
sentences.chinese: 他说他要在邮局把那个包裹投寄掉。

sentences.english: No postage stamp necessary if posted in Hong Kong.
sentences.chinese: 如在本港投寄毋须贴上邮票。

sentences.english: Sender has the responsibility to ensure their mail items bear sufficient postage before posting.
sentences.chinese: 寄件人投寄邮件时有责任支付足够邮资。

sentences.english: Please don't forget to post the letter.

definition: to submit articles for publication/to contribute (writing)
to forward (a message, letter, article etc)
to reply/to write back/letter written in reply/CL:封[feng1]
